Hotel Nikko San Francisco
8.4 Excellent
Based on 535 reviews

For a recent business trip to San Francisco, I chose to stay at the Hotel Nikko due to its central location in Union Square and the overall positive experiences I have had staying there in the past.

Upon arrival, valet and bell staff were pleasant and polite, but the employee at the front desk was disdainful. It seemed to me, that due to my appearance (young and with purple hair), he was uninterested in helping me get settled in my room, which I had paid for several weeks in advance. Once I arrived at my room, I was taken aback by its small size - literally half that of other rooms in the same hotel. However, it was clean and modern and I figured that I wouldn't be spending much time there anyway due to my busy work schedule that weekend. I didn't realize the effect of such a small living space until I awoke at three in the morning to a drunken fistfight and shouting match in one of the adjacent rooms. I could hear every word (as well as every slam of a door or contact with a wall or floor, naturally) and laid awake for two hours as the fighting continued. Needless to say, I was not well rested when I left my hotel room at five in the morning. The smell of smoke filled the halls. In the lobby, a still-drunk man dressed as Superman (it was the morning after Halloween) screamed obscenities through the phone he had borrowed from the front desk. The second night of my stay was marginally better, with my main complaint being that I attempted to use the WiFi and was shocked to realize that internet costs $17 per room per night, with no free internet access to be found in the lobby. I could still hear guests in adjacent rooms very clearly, but was not awoken in the middle of the night by drunken arguing. Checkout was easy, and the valet service was always quick and polite. Despite this, I will not be staying there again.

Show more
Amy , United States
da Vinci Villa Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 189 reviews

Great location and very close to all sites and attractions, however facilities need upgrading. Old smelling carpets give off a smell strong enough to stick to my clean clothes and required me to close my luggage bag.

Breakfast was very average with the option of toast, bagels, waggles, cereal, and boiled eggs. For a 3 star hotel the standards need to be lifted up especially due to its cost and the price paid considering we have stayed at 3 star hotels around the globe from Europe and Asia and had found them all very good for value and clean with a well provided breakfast option, even if it means including a hot food option, like scrambled eggs alongside the boiled eggs that were there or even some bacon. However on a good note, a big thumbs up to all the staff who were very helpful and welcoming.

Show more
Jeremy , Australia
Serrano Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 72 reviews

Great lobby in a slightly dodgy area of San Francisco. Yes you are downtown, a block or two from Union Square, Theaters, etc.

, but the Tenderloin and Market Street are dirty, impoverished areas at your doorstep. The room was smallish but neat and clean with good linens. It had restored charm from an earlier era, but the heating system was loud and one of the two beds left me with a backache that took days to recover from. Otherwise a quiet space 17 floors above the city. I might give it another try based on the staff service and the moderate price. We did not use room service or eat dinner at Ponzu, but breakfast was served slowly, at high price and low quality. You're better off at the Taylor Street Cafe around the block.

Show more
Timothy , United States
The Pickwick Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 135 reviews

I was a little bit concerned when I first looked at review for this hotel on yelp -- there were a lot of complaints, esp.

about cleanliness. When I got there, it was not nearly as bad as it was described -- yelp reviews were probably highly biased for hotels in general in that only dissatisfied customers would post on yelp. I find the room pretty clean, and the bed very soft and comfortable. There is free wifi internet, and in my experience its performance is better than most other hotels with free wifi. The hotel in general is old, and as a result the rooms are somewhat old. You can see cracks in the paint on the wall. The room is also pretty small, barely any room after putting in two double beds and a small desk and dresser. The closet is walk-in and decent size for a hotel room though. Bathroom is similarly small, but clean as well. One thing to note is that the water-pressure is a bit low. Walls are pretty thin, so if you listen carefully you can hear the neighbors talking or the TV. But there are enough ambiance white noise that I don't find it disruptive unless you have really bad neighbors. They don't appear to have a thermostat inside (though there are probably central AC), but just a heater. It's not a problem for me as I traveled in November, but could be problematic in the summer. The price is fairly cheap compare to other options (~$200 per night during a conference in SF, it's at least ~$15-20 per night cheaper than other alternatives with shorter walk). It is very close to the subway station so going to the airport is easy.

Show more
Charleston , United States
Bay Landing Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 210 reviews

I stayed at the Bay Landing SF for one night Aug 5 to the 6th. Everything was good. The gentleman checking us in was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable.

Location was great since we needed a shuttle from the airport. I stayed there on my way to Napa with two life long friends celebrating our 50th birthdays. Everything was fine with a huge exception for the breakfast. The three of us have traveled quite a bit and neither of us has ever had to microwave frozen food as part of a complimentary breakfast. That was surprising, disappointing, time consuming, and really a bit ridiculous. It was a chaotic mess. People were exploding eggs in the microwave, under or over cooking the frozen breakfast items, (everything was either cold or frozen). There were two staff members cleaning the exploded food from microwaves and replenishing the frozen items and coffee as needed. The resources could be much better spent by having the staff members cooking or heating up the breakfast items, cleaning and replenishing and putting the food out on sterno or chafing pans etc. Really? I mean many other hotels have figured that part out. We make our own waffles but the hotel cooks all else, it's not that hard. Did I mention the the food was FROZEN and COLD and the guests had to cook it themselves.? Not good at all!!

Show more
Kimberly , United States
Aida Plaza Hotel
6.3 Good
Based on 673 reviews

My husband and I always book hostels as opposed to big fancy hotels because they are just the better value.

We only use hotels to rest and sleep and the rest of the time we are out and about enjoying the vacation. Aida Plaza Hotel was very inexpensive but was still a decent hotel. The only downfall was we had to pay 40 bucks for overnight parking a block away, but if you didn't drive there that wouldn't be a problem. The hotel is located right next to restraunts, bars and night clubs and pier 39 is only a 45 min walk/9 min drive away!

Show more
Nicole , United States
Hotel Diva
7.7 Very good
Based on 114 reviews

The hotel was under renovation and they made a business decision not to disclose to potential guests at time of reservation, this is poor business behavior and false advertising.

Due to the renovations certain advertised facilities were not available or we had to go elsewhere for it. Only after multiple complaints and chasers were we offered a partial discount as compensation. Old lock and key safe that had no key, hotel didn't have it neither, so we had no safe to use in the room. They offered the reception safe instead where staff had access. Poor lighting in room, so dark couldn't see well. Shower pressure was uncontrollable, shower curtain kept flying inwards onto user when showering.

Show more
Stella , Hong Kong
Grant Plaza Hotel
6.7 Good
Based on 131 reviews

We arrived to the hotel a little bit early and were able to check in which was great. The hotel is under renovations so the reception area is quite cramped.

They didn't do renovations on the weekend which was good. The room looked better then in the photos as we got a renovated room I presume. It was quite small though, but most hotel rooms are in San Fransisco. The bathroom was quite nice as it had been fully revamped. The bed was TINY though. I'm not tall by any means and my feet hung off the bed. They have daily housekeeping service which was fantastic, however they didn't speak English. We had a problem with the hot water in the shower for the first few days. It was Luke warm at best. We told the staff and they came and looked at it after 2 days. (We had the Do Not Disturb sign up and he still knocked and just walked into our room) The walls are very thin. You can hear everything going on outside your door. As it's an older building so the floors creak quite badly. The staff at the counter never looked up to greet us when we left the hotel or came back which isn't the worst thing ever but common courtesy goes a long way. We checked out at 12:30pm and our flight wasn't till 11:00pm. They were able to keep our suitcases there until we left which was a nice touch, seeing as though I didn't want to lug it around the city. It was however off to the side of the construction area behind a privacy screen. Overall the hotel is what it is.... A cheap option not to far from Union Square. (Mind you it's about a 3 block walk away) If you want fancy stay in Union Square and pay more.

Show more
Carla , Australia
Parc 55 San Francisco-A Hilton Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 115 reviews

Parc 55 is a huge hotel with all the amenities one would expect. Location is less than a block from Powell BART stop and Market Street shopping and buses, near Union Square.

Not a scenic location, but one of the most convenient in SFO. We were lucky enough to have been given a room with wonderful Bay view. The housekeeping and reception staff very professional: bell staff inattentive and unpleasant.

Show more
Margaret , United States
Hotel Majestic
7.3 Very good
Based on 103 reviews

On 02/08, the house keeper must have broken a glass inside the bathroom, and she did not report it or clean it properly.

Hence, when I and my wife returned to the room in the evening, my wife met with a terrible accident. She stepped on the broken glass piece and injured herself. There was a lot of blood spill, which your hotel staff also saw, and eventually cleaned. I am attaching a picture of a few more glass pieces that we found in the bathroom (it's on the rim of the sink on the right side). This is unacceptable by any hotel standards, and you will agree too. The guy at the front desk was courteous enough, and offered to null our restaurant charges, which are very minimal. Because of the accident, and the fact that my wife couldn't walk a lot, we basically wrapped up our plans for 02/09, and headed to the airport at 12, even though our flight was to depart only at 5:35PM. We basically lost a morning's worth of sightseeing. I know I booked my trip through a third-party source, but I humbly request you to do the needful, and at least refund us a part of the stay for the inconvenience that was caused. Please do also let your cleaning staff know, and may a warning be served. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you.

Show more
Harish , India
Grand Hyatt San Francisco
8.5 Excellent
Based on 95 reviews

Location , location , Location....very close to union square. walking distance to shop, and only 2 block away from flagship apple store (if you want to que for the latest apple gadget).

Our room is breakfast included so, the breakfast choice is not much, but the view is to brag for. the breakfast was held on the top floor of the hotel, on the clear days, i can see the view of golden gate bridge and alcatraz prison. I like the newly renovated rooms, so chic & Modern.

Show more
siti , Indonesia
Calista Organic Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 53 reviews

I was a bit disappointed in this property. My room was okay, and kinda matched the pictures. There isn't really a lobby area to sit in.

It is just a small room with a minimal desk. The neighborhood has also seen better days, and seemed a bit run down to me. The rooms also do not have AC and the temperatures reached 106 and 103 degrees Fahrenheit while I was there. My room was easily hotter than that. I took to soaking wash cloths in cold water, and placing a dry towel in the rooms small refrigerator/freezer to make them cold. I would then wrap my self in the cold towels. That provide relief for about 5-10 minutes. I barely slept, and was dripping with sweat. So after, 3 nights at the hotel, I decided to call it quits and move to a hotel with AC. And, the hotel has refused to refund any of the nights I did not stay there that I had already paid for. Granted I did purchase the room with a nonrefundable deal and the hotel is sticking to that.

Show more
Steven , United States
Club Donatello
8.7 Excellent
Based on 185 reviews

When we checked in, our room wasn't ready due to a photo shoot being done in it. It delayed our entry for almost an hour.

The reception guy, was very nice and apologetic about it. He got housekeeping to send champagne up to our room. There were 3 adults in our room, the rollaway bed wasn't the most comfortable (it was a bit soft) but the hotel didn't charge us extra for it. Enjoyed having club access for tea/coffee - it gets cold in San Fran during the evenings. The bellhops were very helpful on where to go and how to get around the area. Overall the service was great and the room was comfortable.

Show more
Siling , Singapore
Hotel Union Square
7.3 Very good
Based on 64 reviews

Location was good next to a lot of shopping and food. The exterior and lobby are quite charming with updated furniture and decor.

That's where charm ended. Our room was quite tiny, not at all what was pictured. We could get over that as we were just sleeping there. The bathroom, however, was so small it looked like they got half price for half a sink. Shower and flooring needed to be updated though clean. Our room had the barest of furnishing and little to no decor. Flooring could probably use an upgrade. Bed had just bare minimum with two sheets and small pillows. On top of that we could hear EVERYTHING our neighbor was saying in her own room not even talking loudly. And- heads up- parking is $55/night. I'm used to expensive city parking, but that is incredibly steep especially when we thought we were getting a good deal on a room. Also, no A/C. Luckily we had a blast in San Fran and this did not rain on our parade.

Show more
Elisa , United States
Best Western Plus Americania
7.5 Very good
Based on 54 reviews

Pretty bad overall first impression. The hotel did not wish to recognize my Voucher from Agoda and told me that they did not receive email from Agoda.

They did not want to call Agoda, but told me that I had to be the one to do that and that they did not really have any relationship with Agoda except that Agoda booked some rooms. When then front desk officer called his manager he referred to me in 3rd person as "the guy" instead of "the guest" ...pretty unprofessional service by any standard. We ended up having to leave our suitcases and went to have some lounch while they sortedod out their booking problem. When we got back the Hotel we needed help with the suitcases...2 people + 6 suitcases. The poitier asked if we wanted help, but then ended up asking if we wanted to drive the suitcase cart with 6 suitcases or if he should do it. Pretty interesting question -:) We finally got to the Room. It was nice and clean, and overall pretty good. I put the air condition on the lowest temperature (50) and waited for a few hours before I finally called down to the from desk to get some help with the air conditioning.....believe it for not but this hotel located in California only have a heater and not a cooler. We will choose a better hotel next time, Best Western clearly made a mistake in putting their name on this one

Show more
Henrik , Denmark
Hilton San Francisco Union Square Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 366 reviews

This Hilton was a bit of a disappointment. I've stayed or dined at many Hiltons around the world and rarely not been pleased.

The structure is aging, the service of the staff is lackluster (except for concierge, they are great), the acoustics of the bar are such that if there are more than about a dozen customers you can't have a conversation. The deal through Agoda was cheap, but then the hotel nickles and dimes you on everything. WiFi in the center of the IT industry? That'll be $19 bucks a day. A soda from the vending machine is $4. A fridge for your room, an extra $25. Big lines at check-in becase they've only got 2 or 3 staff on the 30 meter counter. Union square is great, but this hotel is more towards the seedy side of the area so there are homeless knee-deep right outside the doors at all times. This Hilton is primarily a convention venue so they've got a captive market attitude. Shop around, you can find better than this place.

Show more
Jason , United States
The Fairmont San Francisco Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 84 reviews

We were told, after waiting nearly an hour to check-in, that we did not have a room. We were told they had "sold" their last room before noon that day and that there was no way we had a room despite that I had the voucher that showed that we did.

(I made and paid for my reservation near 6:00pm that day.) They said there was nothing they could do. We would need to talk to you. We told them we had paid for our room and that it was their responsibility to either find us a room in the Fairmont or to find us a room in a similar class hotel. The woman speaking with us disappeared again and when she came back, magically she had a room available after all. Imagine that. When we got to the room, we found out it was for handicapped persons and we are not handicapped but at that point, we had to be somewhere and didn't have any more time to deal with the front desk. The whole episode put us off this hotel. We lost an entire hour just trying to check in. And to have her insist that we couldn't possibly have booked a room was really insulting.

Show more
Pamela , United States
The St. Regis San Francisco
9.9 Exceptional
Based on 6 reviews

Palace Hotel a Luxury Collection Hotel San Francisco
8.4 Excellent
Based on 45 reviews

If you can do without free wifi in your room and don't intend to drive, this hotel is great. Valet parking costs 59 per night before tax, but being unfamiliar with the city we decided to use it.

The rooms are very clean as with all hotels I've stayed in the states. The hotel lobby and rooms are tastefully decorated. We visited the Golden Gate Bridge using their public transport system, and the bus stops are on the same street outside the hotel. There are also numerous dining places to choose from near the hotel. We checked out in the evening of 4th of July, and thinking that there would be a jam, overestimated the time to get to the airport. We ended up reaching the airport within 15 minutes instead of the budgeted 3 hours, and waited at the airport for more than 6 hours. There were no jams, no road closures or block-ups from the hotel to the airport despite it being Independence Day. Should have used the hotel pool or checked out the restaurant, maybe even time for both. We were in transit to SFO after visiting a few national parks in the other states, and sadly the only amenities we used were the room itself. I heard there was free coffee at the lobby area but we didn't find it.

Show more
Wan , Singapore
Nob Hill Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 215 reviews

We loved staying here, buses and taxis were either outside the door or just around the corner, staff were helpful and friendly, rooms beautiful, clean and generous sized, breakfast was served in a lovely streetside cafe which turned into an Italian restaurant for lunch and dinner.

Free wifi was a bonus and many recommendations for trips and tours were helpful. Get the airport shuttle, not taxis from the airport as they are only about 30 dollars and taxis are about 50 dollars from the airport. Just beware of the Tenderloin district if you are walking around- there are a lot of homeless people - however they are very friendly and don't harass you.

Show more
Anne , Australia
Hotel Metropolis
7 Very good
Based on 70 reviews

i was travelling with my children,good location, near Bart station and shopping area. lots of homeless people.

First day of my arrival, I found that there are no reservation in their records (I have book 4 months and paid all in advance). so I have to call agoda to recheck. My rooms were on 2nd floor next to elevator and exit doors. with noise all day and night as well as noise from outside the hotel from homeless people around the area shouting at night. We feel unsafe if we go back hotel after 8.30 pm due to the homeless. BTW,I'm so glad we stayed here! it's true there are homeless people of all ages around the hotel, but then they are harmless. just don't listen to them and don't stare at them. the reason there's plenty of homeless in this particular area is because there's a homeless shelter down the road... daytime there were police around the area just standing in the corner so we felt safe. and then at night i went out walking on market street and there were the homeless again, but then they're all over the city anyways...loved the shopping around union square too... room was too small for our luggage and had no refridgerator which was the major negative for us...but beds were nice and big and Literally across the street was a huge multi story mall (westfield san francisco) so you don't have to go far to find brand names like kate spade, timberland, etc...there's also a boutique supermarket in the basement of that mall. pinecrest diner up the street along mason about 5 blocks up mason is great.

I was checked into a room that was not made! This is the first time that something like this happened to me and I was indeed very traumatized by it.

This time round, the room was much much better but I was still shaken by the terrible experience. Ailing , Singapore
The Cartwright Hotel Union Square
7.4 Very good
Based on 52 reviews

The Cartwright is located on Sutter Street just a short hop from Union Square in the heart of SF. Parking is at a real premium here and the hotel has an agreement with a garage one block away which charged us about 30USD per day, good value given the other prices advertised.

The staff were extremely friendly at check in and throughout our stay and were a real feature of the hotel. The hotel itself is not 'new'. It is housed in an older block which means the rooms are a little quirkier than a standard new build hotel. Ours was on the top floor and looked onto the back of other apartment blocks, so not a gat view but it was very quiet at night. The room had high ceilings and a fan above the bed which adequately ventilated things. The bathroom was a little small but very clean with a decent shower. Whilst some of the fixtures and fittings were not new, things were perfectly clean. Access to the main shopping areas is superb, just 5 mins walk. The same for public transport (BART, buses, trams). Fisherman's Wharf and Nob Hill are all within walking distance albeit up some steep streets! The are several options for breakfast nearby (the hotel itself serves no breakfast). All in all, a clean, well located and friendly hotel in a busy part of Downtown SF that felt safe at all times.

Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf
7.3 Very good
Based on 74 reviews

We stayed with friends at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. We had connecting rooms 4110 and 4112. The room sizes were great and the layout was nice, the desk was in a lovely position under the window.

However, the hotel was extremely noisy. You could hear people talking in the corridors, the air conditioning/heating was so loud that it could not be on while sleeping or watching TV and the was a lot of noise from the fire pits. These were meant to close at 11pm but the noise continued a lot later than that. There was also a problem with a lack of staff at reception and at the valvet counter. Parking was very expensive, $45 a day and yet the parking valvet (who was also the cashier) was working on his own so if he was parking a car then the counter was left un-manned until he was able to return which led to long waits. There were hardly any reception staff either. One day one of the rooms we were staying in was not cleaned. When we called to mention it we were accused of leaving the "Do Not Disturb" sign on, which we had not done, then told the cleaners could not come for a while as they were taking a break. When the cleaners did turn up, one of our friends had fallen asleep due to jet lag and while the cleaner made the second bed, she piled all the bedding on top of our sleeping friend! I would not stay here again. It was far too noisy and it was irritating to never be able to find a member of staff to assist with anything. Having said that, the bellboys were extremely helpful.

we arrived on a late flight at sfo and called the hotel for our scheduled shuttle pickup. we followed the instructions given to us over the phone and found our shuttle already be waiting for us! passengers were still coming off and i told the driver i was heading to the dylan and he said "okay" and when he finished assisting the party, he jumped into his bus and was about to drive away.

i knocked on the doors and asked if he could take us to the dylan millbrae (like his sign said). he then told me "i'm not your shuttle this time!" and drove off. after 20 minutes of waiting in the cold, two more shuttles came by with the same millbrae dylan sign and when i tried to get on the second time, the same driver said, "i told you it's not me! that's your bus! catch him, he's about to leave!" as the driver was shutting the doors... not a happy start for travelodge dylan. we scheduled a shuttle for us to take us back to the airport as well. they told us the shuttle would arrive between 8-8:15am, and after waiting 15 minutes and no shuttle, we caught a cab which arrived in less than 5 minutes. breakfast is simple and great, room is clean. would like more direction with the shuttle pickup system and a little more maintenance on the significantly torn areas of the carpet and wallpaper in the room.

King George Hotel

Considering this hotel is in the Tenderloin District (well I'd say the boarder of it) it was a pretty decent hotel for an affordable price.

The hotel is in one of the best convenient locations which have everything at your doorstep without being too congested or noisy. You have the BART (Powell St Station), the MUNI and Cable Carts within 2 blocks from the hotel. It's also extremely close to shops such as Macy's, Bloomingdale and Nordstrom which is a shoppers dream having everything pretty much at your door step. The only downer would be the slow elevator. There is only one and you can find yourself waiting a while. Another downer is the homeless people around the area but I found that you found this all over San Francisco. Also if you treat them with a little respect they will tend to be friendly back. As a single female traveler I had no issue with this nor felt scared compared to some other areas of Tenderloin. The hotel does have small rooms however I've stayed in much smaller. I also don't tend to spend my entire time in the hotel room so this did not both us at all. The beds were comfortable, linen was clean, the showers had great pressure and were hot. The internet speed was amazingly fast too. Would I stay here again? For sure!! I actually had booked this hotel for 3 nights and had to come back to San Francisco for my last night so I re-booked this hotel for my last day in San Francisco. If I come back I'd definitely stay here again.

Please go beyond 2 nights. 3-5 nights is the minimum for you to enjoy San Francisco. The must visit places are Alcatraz, Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf (they said it's the 2nd most visited places after Disneyland), Golden Gate Bridge, and Union Square (for shopping paradise).

If you have limited time, please do hop on hop off bus tour on your first day so you have the idea what are the places you really want to visit. Try to ride on the cable car even only once. Tips for travelers: please don't think summer months (June-August) are hot in San Francisco because it's foggy. When the fog comes, the temperature drops. End of September to early October is nice since it's warmer. When it's warm (no fog) you'll be able to see the view clearly (Golden Gate, etc). Also, enjoy the free fireworks show every Saturday in October (you may go on evening tour on a boat to see the it with the city skyline as the background). When you have more days, go for a walk in Presidio Park and visit the museums.

More about San Francisco (CA)

San Francisco is a vibrant and multi-faceted city with much to explore. Truly one of the world's greatest destinations, San Francisco hotels include some of the world's hippest, and all are generally easy to reach from San Francisco International Airport. For those in transit, a hotel near the airport is also easy to find.

San Francisco is known for its liberal community, hilly terrain, Victorian architecture, scenic beauty, and great ethnic and cultural diversity. Since the days of the Californian gold rush, the city has become a mecca for travelers and fortune seekers, and today the city reflects its roots in its many ethnic neighborhoods and barrios, all offering a taste of something different.

For the visitor, choosing accommodation in downtown San Francisco is the best way to explore the city. Hop on and off the trams at leisure, take a ferry across the bay underneath the famous Golden Gate Bridge, or just wander through wonderfully preserved colonial streets.

More city sites not to be missed include Fisherman's Wharf for amazing street performers and fantastic seafood restaurants, Chinatown, and the famous Alcatraz Island.

LinkPoints Programme Qatar Airways Privilege Club reward-U Royal Skies Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer SkyPearl Club SM Advantage/ BDO Rewards Thai Airways Royal Orchid Plus The 1 Card Thailand TudoAzul United MileagePlus Velocity Frequent Flyer WAON POINT Featured Hotels Hotel Resort Guest House Apartment Villa Hotel Nikko San Francisco 8.4 Excellent Based on 535 reviews For a recent business trip to San Francisco, I chose to stay at the Hotel Nikko due to its central location in Union Square and the overall positive experiences I have had staying there in the past. Upon arrival, valet and bell staff were pleasant and polite, but the employee at the front desk was disdainful. It seemed to me, that due to my appearance (young and with purple hair), he was uninterested in helping me get settled in my room, which I had paid for several weeks in advance. Once I arrived at my room, I was taken aback by its small size - literally half that of other rooms in the same hotel. However, it was clean and modern and I figured that I wouldn't be spending much time there anyway due to my busy work schedule that weekend. I didn't realize the effect of such a small living space until I awoke at three in the morning to a drunken fistfight and shouting match in one of the adjacent rooms. I could hear every word (as well as every slam of a door or contact with a wall or floor, naturally) and laid awake for two hours as the fighting continued. Needless to say, I was not well rested when I left my hotel room at five in the morning. The smell of smoke filled the halls. In the lobby, a still-drunk man dressed as Superman (it was the morning after Halloween) screamed obscenities through the phone he had borrowed from the front desk. The second night of my stay was marginally better, with my main complaint being that I attempted to use the WiFi and was shocked to realize that internet costs $17 per room per night, with no free internet access to be found in the lobby. I could still hear guests in adjacent rooms very clearly, but was not awoken in the middle of the night by drunken arguing. Checkout was easy, and the valet service was always quick and polite. Despite this, I will not be staying there again. Show more Amy , United States da Vinci Villa Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 189 reviews Great location and very close to all sites and attractions, however facilities need upgrading. Old smelling carpets give off a smell strong enough to stick to my clean clothes and required me to close my luggage bag. Breakfast was very average with the option of toast, bagels, waggles, cereal, and boiled eggs. For a 3 star hotel the standards need to be lifted up especially due to its cost and the price paid considering we have stayed at 3 star hotels around the globe from Europe and Asia and had found them all very good for value and clean with a well provided breakfast option, even if it means including a hot food option, like scrambled eggs alongside the boiled eggs that were there or even some bacon. However on a good note, a big thumbs up to all the staff who were very helpful and welcoming. Show more Jeremy , Australia Serrano Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 72 reviews Great lobby in a slightly dodgy area of San Francisco. Yes you are downtown, a block or two from Union Square, Theaters, etc. , but the Tenderloin and Market Street are dirty, impoverished areas at your doorstep. The room was smallish but neat and clean with good linens. It had restored charm from an earlier era, but the heating system was loud and one of the two beds left me with a backache that took days to recover from. Otherwise a quiet space 17 floors above the city. I might give it another try based on the staff service and the moderate price. We did not use room service or eat dinner at Ponzu, but breakfast was served slowly, at high price and low quality. You're better off at the Taylor Street Cafe around the block. Show more Timothy , United States The Pickwick Hotel 7.4 Very good Based on 135 reviews I was a little bit concerned when I first looked at review for this hotel on yelp -- there were a lot of complaints, esp. about cleanliness. When I got there, it was not nearly as bad as it was described -- yelp reviews were probably highly biased for hotels in general in that only dissatisfied customers would post on yelp. I find the room pretty clean, and the bed very soft and comfortable. There is free wifi internet, and in my experience its performance is better than most other hotels with free wifi. The hotel in general is old, and as a result the rooms are somewhat old. You can see cracks in the paint on the wall. The room is also pretty small, barely any room after putting in two double beds and a small desk and dresser. The closet is walk-in and decent size for a hotel room though. Bathroom is similarly small, but clean as well. One thing to note is that the water-pressure is a bit low. Walls are pretty thin, so if you listen carefully you can hear the neighbors talking or the TV. But there are enough ambiance white noise that I don't find it disruptive unless you have really bad neighbors. They don't appear to have a thermostat inside (though there are probably central AC), but just a heater. It's not a problem for me as I traveled in November, but could be problematic in the summer. The price is fairly cheap compare to other options (~$200 per night during a conference in SF, it's at least ~$15-20 per night cheaper than other alternatives with shorter walk). It is very close to the subway station so going to the airport is easy. Show more Charleston , United States Bay Landing Hotel 8.3 Excellent Based on 210 reviews I stayed at the Bay Landing SF for one night Aug 5 to the 6th. Everything was good. The gentleman checking us in was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable. Location was great since we needed a shuttle from the airport. I stayed there on my way to Napa with two life long friends celebrating our 50th birthdays. Everything was fine with a huge exception for the breakfast. The three of us have traveled quite a bit and neither of us has ever had to microwave frozen food as part of a complimentary breakfast. That was surprising, disappointing, time consuming, and really a bit ridiculous. It was a chaotic mess. People were exploding eggs in the microwave, under or over cooking the frozen breakfast items, (everything was either cold or frozen). There were two staff members cleaning the exploded food from microwaves and replenishing the frozen items and coffee as needed. The resources could be much better spent by having the staff members cooking or heating up the breakfast items, cleaning and replenishing and putting the food out on sterno or chafing pans etc. Really? I mean many other hotels have figured that part out. We make our own waffles but the hotel cooks all else, it's not that hard. Did I mention the the food was FROZEN and COLD and the guests had to cook it themselves.? Not good at all!! Show more Kimberly , United States Aida Plaza Hotel 6.3 Good Based on 673 reviews My husband and I always book hostels as opposed to big fancy hotels because they are just the better value. We only use hotels to rest and sleep and the rest of the time we are out and about enjoying the vacation. Aida Plaza Hotel was very inexpensive but was still a decent hotel. The only downfall was we had to pay 40 bucks for overnight parking a block away, but if you didn't drive there that wouldn't be a problem. The hotel is located right next to restraunts, bars and night clubs and pier 39 is only a 45 min walk/9 min drive away! Show more Nicole , United States Hotel Diva 7.7 Very good Based on 114 reviews The hotel was under renovation and they made a business decision not to disclose to potential guests at time of reservation, this is poor business behavior and false advertising. Due to the renovations certain advertised facilities were not available or we had to go elsewhere for it. Only after multiple complaints and chasers were we offered a partial discount as compensation. Old lock and key safe that had no key, hotel didn't have it neither, so we had no safe to use in the room. They offered the reception safe instead where staff had access. Poor lighting in room, so dark couldn't see well. Shower pressure was uncontrollable, shower curtain kept flying inwards onto user when showering. Show more Stella , Hong Kong Grant Plaza Hotel 6.7 Good Based on 131 reviews We arrived to the hotel a little bit early and were able to check in which was great. The hotel is under renovations so the reception area is quite cramped. They didn't do renovations on the weekend which was good. The room looked better then in the photos as we got a renovated room I presume. It was quite small though, but most hotel rooms are in San Fransisco. The bathroom was quite nice as it had been fully revamped. The bed was TINY though. I'm not tall by any means and my feet hung off the bed. They have daily housekeeping service which was fantastic, however they didn't speak English. We had a problem with the hot water in the shower for the first few days. It was Luke warm at best. We told the staff and they came and looked at it after 2 days. (We had the Do Not Disturb sign up and he still knocked and just walked into our room) The walls are very thin. You can hear everything going on outside your door. As it's an older building so the floors creak quite badly. The staff at the counter never looked up to greet us when we left the hotel or came back which isn't the worst thing ever but common courtesy goes a long way. We checked out at 12:30pm and our flight wasn't till 11:00pm. They were able to keep our suitcases there until we left which was a nice touch, seeing as though I didn't want to lug it around the city. It was however off to the side of the construction area behind a privacy screen. Overall the hotel is what it is.... A cheap option not to far from Union Square. (Mind you it's about a 3 block walk away) If you want fancy stay in Union Square and pay more. Show more Carla , Australia Parc 55 San Francisco-A Hilton Hotel 8.4 Excellent Based on 115 reviews Parc 55 is a huge hotel with all the amenities one would expect. Location is less than a block from Powell BART stop and Market Street shopping and buses, near Union Square. Not a scenic location, but one of the most convenient in SFO. We were lucky enough to have been given a room with wonderful Bay view. The housekeeping and reception staff very professional: bell staff inattentive and unpleasant. Show more Margaret , United States Hotel Majestic 7.3 Very good Based on 103 reviews On 02/08, the house keeper must have broken a glass inside the bathroom, and she did not report it or clean it properly. Hence, when I and my wife returned to the room in the evening, my wife met with a terrible accident. She stepped on the broken glass piece and injured herself. There was a lot of blood spill, which your hotel staff also saw, and eventually cleaned. I am attaching a picture of a few more glass pieces that we found in the bathroom (it's on the rim of the sink on the right side). This is unacceptable by any hotel standards, and you will agree too. The guy at the front desk was courteous enough, and offered to null our restaurant charges, which are very minimal. Because of the accident, and the fact that my wife couldn't walk a lot, we basically wrapped up our plans for 02/09, and headed to the airport at 12, even though our flight was to depart only at 5:35PM. We basically lost a morning's worth of sightseeing. I know I booked my trip through a third-party source, but I humbly request you to do the needful, and at least refund us a part of the stay for the inconvenience that was caused. Please do also let your cleaning staff know, and may a warning be served. We look forward to hearing from you. Thank you. Show more Harish , India Grand Hyatt San Francisco 8.5 Excellent Based on 95 reviews Location , location , Location....very close to union square. walking distance to shop, and only 2 block away from flagship apple store (if you want to que for the latest apple gadget). Our room is breakfast included so, the breakfast choice is not much, but the view is to brag for. the breakfast was held on the top floor of the hotel, on the clear days, i can see the view of golden gate bridge and alcatraz prison. I like the newly renovated rooms, so chic & Modern. Show more siti , Indonesia Calista Organic Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 53 reviews I was a bit disappointed in this property. My room was okay, and kinda matched the pictures. There isn't really a lobby area to sit in. It is just a small room with a minimal desk. The neighborhood has also seen better days, and seemed a bit run down to me. The rooms also do not have AC and the temperatures reached 106 and 103 degrees Fahrenheit while I was there. My room was easily hotter than that. I took to soaking wash cloths in cold water, and placing a dry towel in the rooms small refrigerator/freezer to make them cold. I would then wrap my self in the cold towels. That provide relief for about 5-10 minutes. I barely slept, and was dripping with sweat. So after, 3 nights at the hotel, I decided to call it quits and move to a hotel with AC. And, the hotel has refused to refund any of the nights I did not stay there that I had already paid for. Granted I did purchase the room with a nonrefundable deal and the hotel is sticking to that. Show more Steven , United States Club Donatello 8.7 Excellent Based on 185 reviews When we checked in, our room wasn't ready due to a photo shoot being done in it. It delayed our entry for almost an hour. The reception guy, was very nice and apologetic about it. He got housekeeping to send champagne up to our room. There were 3 adults in our room, the rollaway bed wasn't the most comfortable (it was a bit soft) but the hotel didn't charge us extra for it. Enjoyed having club access for tea/coffee - it gets cold in San Fran during the evenings. The bellhops were very helpful on where to go and how to get around the area. Overall the service was great and the room was comfortable. Show more Siling , Singapore Hotel Union Square 7.3 Very good Based on 64 reviews Location was good next to a lot of shopping and food. The exterior and lobby are quite charming with updated furniture and decor. That's where charm ended. Our room was quite tiny, not at all what was pictured. We could get over that as we were just sleeping there. The bathroom, however, was so small it looked like they got half price for half a sink. Shower and flooring needed to be updated though clean. Our room had the barest of furnishing and little to no decor. Flooring could probably use an upgrade. Bed had just bare minimum with two sheets and small pillows. On top of that we could hear EVERYTHING our neighbor was saying in her own room not even talking loudly. And- heads up- parking is $55/night. I'm used to expensive city parking, but that is incredibly steep especially when we thought we were getting a good deal on a room. Also, no A/C. Luckily we had a blast in San Fran and this did not rain on our parade. Show more Elisa , United States Best Western Plus Americania 7.5 Very good Based on 54 reviews Pretty bad overall first impression. The hotel did not wish to recognize my Voucher from Agoda and told me that they did not receive email from Agoda. They did not want to call Agoda, but told me that I had to be the one to do that and that they did not really have any relationship with Agoda except that Agoda booked some rooms. When then front desk officer called his manager he referred to me in 3rd person as "the guy" instead of "the guest" ...pretty unprofessional service by any standard. We ended up having to leave our suitcases and went to have some lounch while they sortedod out their booking problem. When we got back the Hotel we needed help with the suitcases...2 people + 6 suitcases. The poitier asked if we wanted help, but then ended up asking if we wanted to drive the suitcase cart with 6 suitcases or if he should do it. Pretty interesting question -:) We finally got to the Room. It was nice and clean, and overall pretty good. I put the air condition on the lowest temperature (50) and waited for a few hours before I finally called down to the from desk to get some help with the air conditioning.....believe it for not but this hotel located in California only have a heater and not a cooler. We will choose a better hotel next time, Best Western clearly made a mistake in putting their name on this one Show more Henrik , Denmark Hilton San Francisco Union Square Hotel 7.8 Very good Based on 366 reviews This Hilton was a bit of a disappointment. I've stayed or dined at many Hiltons around the world and rarely not been pleased. The structure is aging, the service of the staff is lackluster (except for concierge, they are great), the acoustics of the bar are such that if there are more than about a dozen customers you can't have a conversation. The deal through Agoda was cheap, but then the hotel nickles and dimes you on everything. WiFi in the center of the IT industry? That'll be $19 bucks a day. A soda from the vending machine is $4. A fridge for your room, an extra $25. Big lines at check-in becase they've only got 2 or 3 staff on the 30 meter counter. Union square is great, but this hotel is more towards the seedy side of the area so there are homeless knee-deep right outside the doors at all times. This Hilton is primarily a convention venue so they've got a captive market attitude. Shop around, you can find better than this place. Show more Jason , United States The Fairmont San Francisco Hotel 8.5 Excellent Based on 84 reviews We were told, after waiting nearly an hour to check-in, that we did not have a room. We were told they had "sold" their last room before noon that day and that there was no way we had a room despite that I had the voucher that showed that we did. (I made and paid for my reservation near 6:00pm that day.) They said there was nothing they could do. We would need to talk to you. We told them we had paid for our room and that it was their responsibility to either find us a room in the Fairmont or to find us a room in a similar class hotel. The woman speaking with us disappeared again and when she came back, magically she had a room available after all. Imagine that. When we got to the room, we found out it was for handicapped persons and we are not handicapped but at that point, we had to be somewhere and didn't have any more time to deal with the front desk. The whole episode put us off this hotel. We lost an entire hour just trying to check in. And to have her insist that we couldn't possibly have booked a room was really insulting. Show more Pamela , United States The St. Regis San Francisco 9.9 Exceptional Based on 6 reviews Palace Hotel a Luxury Collection Hotel San Francisco 8.4 Excellent Based on 45 reviews If you can do without free wifi in your room and don't intend to drive, this hotel is great. Valet parking costs 59 per night before tax, but being unfamiliar with the city we decided to use it. The rooms are very clean as with all hotels I've stayed in the states. The hotel lobby and rooms are tastefully decorated. We visited the Golden Gate Bridge using their public transport system, and the bus stops are on the same street outside the hotel. There are also numerous dining places to choose from near the hotel. We checked out in the evening of 4th of July, and thinking that there would be a jam, overestimated the time to get to the airport. We ended up reaching the airport within 15 minutes instead of the budgeted 3 hours, and waited at the airport for more than 6 hours. There were no jams, no road closures or block-ups from the hotel to the airport despite it being Independence Day. Should have used the hotel pool or checked out the restaurant, maybe even time for both. We were in transit to SFO after visiting a few national parks in the other states, and sadly the only amenities we used were the room itself. I heard there was free coffee at the lobby area but we didn't find it. Show more Wan , Singapore Nob Hill Hotel 7.3 Very good Based on 215 reviews We loved staying here, buses and taxis were either outside the door or just around the corner, staff were helpful and friendly, rooms beautiful, clean and generous sized, breakfast was served in a lovely streetside cafe which turned into an Italian restaurant for lunch and dinner. Free wifi was a bonus and many recommendations for trips and tours were helpful. Get the airport shuttle, not taxis from the airport as they are only about 30 dollars and taxis are about 50 dollars from the airport. Just beware of the Tenderloin district if you are walking around- there are a lot of homeless people - however they are very friendly and don't harass you. Show more Anne , Australia Hotel Metropolis 7 Very good Based on 70 reviews i was travelling with my children,good location, near Bart station and shopping area. lots of homeless people. First day of my arrival, I found that there are no reservation in their records (I have book 4 months and paid all in advance). so I have to call agoda to recheck. My rooms were on 2nd floor next to elevator and exit doors. with noise all day and night as well as noise from outside the hotel from homeless people around the area shouting at night. We feel unsafe if we go back hotel after 8.30 pm due to the homeless. BTW,I'm so glad we stayed here! it's true there are homeless people of all ages around the hotel, but then they are harmless. just don't listen to them and don't stare at them. the reason there's plenty of homeless in this particular area is because there's a homeless shelter down the road... daytime there were police around the area just standing in the corner so we felt safe. and then at night i went out walking on market street and there were the homeless again, but then they're all over the city anyways...loved the shopping around union square too... room was too small for our luggage and had no refridgerator which was the major negative for us...but beds were nice and big and Literally across the street was a huge multi story mall (westfield san francisco) so you don't have to go far to find brand names like kate spade, timberland, etc...there's also a boutique supermarket in the basement of that mall. pinecrest diner up the street along mason about 5 blocks up mason is great. Show more Thongchai , Thailand Carriage Inn 6.8 Good Based on 14 reviews Union Square Plaza Hotel 6.8 Good Based on 304 reviews I was checked into a room that was not made! This is the first time that something like this happened to me and I was indeed very traumatized by it. My first thought when I saw this was what kind of hotel have I got myself into. The bed sheets were pulled over and has strands of hair on it. Towels were dirty with stains. Apparently someone forgot to make up the room for whoever stayed in it previously. I went back down and explained to the staff and he apologized and gave me another room immediately. This time round, the room was much much better but I was still shaken by the terrible experience. I stayed for 3 nights because I have already paid for it but I certainly will not recommend this hotel to anyone. I regretted my decision because it was simply not worth it at all. Show more Ailing , Singapore The Cartwright Hotel Union Square 7.4 Very good Based on 52 reviews The Cartwright is located on Sutter Street just a short hop from Union Square in the heart of SF. Parking is at a real premium here and the hotel has an agreement with a garage one block away which charged us about 30USD per day, good value given the other prices advertised. The staff were extremely friendly at check in and throughout our stay and were a real feature of the hotel. The hotel itself is not 'new'. It is housed in an older block which means the rooms are a little quirkier than a standard new build hotel. Ours was on the top floor and looked onto the back of other apartment blocks, so not a gat view but it was very quiet at night. The room had high ceilings and a fan above the bed which adequately ventilated things. The bathroom was a little small but very clean with a decent shower. Whilst some of the fixtures and fittings were not new, things were perfectly clean. Access to the main shopping areas is superb, just 5 mins walk. The same for public transport (BART, buses, trams). Fisherman's Wharf and Nob Hill are all within walking distance albeit up some steep streets! The are several options for breakfast nearby (the hotel itself serves no breakfast). All in all, a clean, well located and friendly hotel in a busy part of Downtown SF that felt safe at all times. Show more Christian , United Kingdom Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf 7.3 Very good Based on 74 reviews We stayed with friends at the Sheraton Fisherman's Wharf. We had connecting rooms 4110 and 4112. The room sizes were great and the layout was nice, the desk was in a lovely position under the window. However, the hotel was extremely noisy. You could hear people talking in the corridors, the air conditioning/heating was so loud that it could not be on while sleeping or watching TV and the was a lot of noise from the fire pits. These were meant to close at 11pm but the noise continued a lot later than that. There was also a problem with a lack of staff at reception and at the valvet counter. Parking was very expensive, $45 a day and yet the parking valvet (who was also the cashier) was working on his own so if he was parking a car then the counter was left un-manned until he was able to return which led to long waits. There were hardly any reception staff either. One day one of the rooms we were staying in was not cleaned. When we called to mention it we were accused of leaving the "Do Not Disturb" sign on, which we had not done, then told the cleaners could not come for a while as they were taking a break. When the cleaners did turn up, one of our friends had fallen asleep due to jet lag and while the cleaner made the second bed, she piled all the bedding on top of our sleeping friend! I would not stay here again. It was far too noisy and it was irritating to never be able to find a member of staff to assist with anything. Having said that, the bellboys were extremely helpful. Show more Stephen , United Kingdom The Dylan Hotel at SFO 7.8 Very good Based on 127 reviews we arrived on a late flight at sfo and called the hotel for our scheduled shuttle pickup. we followed the instructions given to us over the phone and found our shuttle already be waiting for us! passengers were still coming off and i told the driver i was heading to the dylan and he said "okay" and when he finished assisting the party, he jumped into his bus and was about to drive away. i knocked on the doors and asked if he could take us to the dylan millbrae (like his sign said). he then told me "i'm not your shuttle this time!" and drove off. after 20 minutes of waiting in the cold, two more shuttles came by with the same millbrae dylan sign and when i tried to get on the second time, the same driver said, "i told you it's not me! that's your bus! catch him, he's about to leave!" as the driver was shutting the doors... not a happy start for travelodge dylan. we scheduled a shuttle for us to take us back to the airport as well. they told us the shuttle would arrive between 8-8:15am, and after waiting 15 minutes and no shuttle, we caught a cab which arrived in less than 5 minutes. breakfast is simple and great, room is clean. would like more direction with the shuttle pickup system and a little more maintenance on the significantly torn areas of the carpet and wallpaper in the room. Show more Tennile , United States Stanford Court San Francisco Hotel 8.1 Excellent Based on 99 reviews I had a great time in SF. My weekend almost got ruined by another guest who stayed in a room adjacent to mine. This individual stole my wallet and caused a scene with his guests while I confronted him regarding the incident. I notified hotel staff who went above and beyond to help me. Long story short I was able to get my wallet with a few missing things but the most important items were still there. The security staff helped out and also the front desk personal. This incident could have changed how I felt about SF but it played out as best possible which I think it's because of the hotel and its staff. Unfortunately there are some individuals who choose to commit crimes while people are enjoying themselves. Overall I had a great time and would recommend the hotel. Show more Manuel , United States Pullman San Francisco Bay 8.2 Excellent Based on 55 reviews Everything was well taken care of. The parking was close by and easy to use. The room was bright and clean and the staff were friendly and efficient. I have no negative comments except that the air conditioning in the room was not working very well. I mentioned this to the desk staff and when I returened they informed me of what the maintenence man did to fix the problem. However it was not fixed, I think he went to the wrong room since our fridge was not in front of the air ducts as he said it was. The A/C problem will not deter us from recommending this hotel to others and we look forward to staying at your other hotels. Thank You Show more Robert , Canada King George Hotel 7.7 Very good Based on 237 reviews Considering this hotel is in the Tenderloin District (well I'd say the boarder of it) it was a pretty decent hotel for an affordable price. The hotel is in one of the best convenient locations which have everything at your doorstep without being too congested or noisy. You have the BART (Powell St Station), the MUNI and Cable Carts within 2 blocks from the hotel. It's also extremely close to shops such as Macy's, Bloomingdale and Nordstrom which is a shoppers dream having everything pretty much at your door step. The only downer would be the slow elevator. There is only one and you can find yourself waiting a while. Another downer is the homeless people around the area but I found that you found this all over San Francisco. Also if you treat them with a little respect they will tend to be friendly back. As a single female traveler I had no issue with this nor felt scared compared to some other areas of Tenderloin. The hotel does have small rooms however I've stayed in much smaller. I also don't tend to spend my entire time in the hotel room so this did not both us at all. The beds were comfortable, linen was clean, the showers had great pressure and were hot. The internet speed was amazingly fast too. Would I stay here again? For sure!! I actually had booked this hotel for 3 nights and had to come back to San Francisco for my last night so I re-booked this hotel for my last day in San Francisco. Truly one of the world's greatest destinations, San Francisco hotels include some of the world's hippest, and all are generally easy to reach from San Francisco International Airport . For those in transit, a hotel near the airport is also easy to find. San Francisco is known for its liberal community, hilly terrain, Victorian architecture, scenic beauty, and great ethnic and cultural diversity. Since the days of the Californian gold rush, the city has become a mecca for travelers and fortune seekers, and today the city reflects its roots in its many ethnic neighborhoods and barrios, all offering a taste of something different. For the visitor, choosing accommodation in downtown San Francisco is the best way to explore the city. Hop on and off the trams at leisure, take a ferry across the bay underneath the famous Golden Gate Bridge , or just wander through wonderfully preserved colonial streets. More city sites not to be missed include Fisherman's Wharf for amazing street performers and fantastic seafood restaurants, Chinatown, and the famous Alcatraz Island .
